result.execSummary:
The defendant Doneal Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $5,774.00  through the Clerk of Courts to Markeshia M. Joint and several with  Antonio Scarbrough 14CF1279 . By the end of sentence or civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
**DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Antonio Scarbrough.
Any cognitive intervention or vocational traiing as recommended.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must proovide a DNA sample, and pay the mandatory surcharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated March 29, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP002009 CR, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on February 21, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that his appeal is voluntarily dismissd.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.18 (2015-16).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order dismissing

records.addlTxt: Per order dated February 21, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2009-CR, IT IS ORFDERED that this appeal is voluntarily dismissed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.18 (2015-16)

per order dated January 26, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP2009-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the notice of voluntary dismissal is held in abeyance pending further order of this court. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that by February 26, 2018, counsel for Bell shall file a statement confirming whether Bell wishes to voluntarily dismiss his appeal. The statement must be personally signed by Bell and otherwise be in accord with this order.
Per Order Dated November 20, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP2009-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the time to file a notice of appeal is extended to October 10, 2017.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Doneal Bell in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Defendant Doneal Bell in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Dafasha B. and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 13 years with 364 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 8 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 5 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection; pay restitution of $5,774 through the Clerk of Courts to Markeshia M. - joint and several with Antonio Scarbrough 14cf1279 by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) any cognitive intervention or vocational training as recommended; 4) no contact with Antonio Scarbrough; 5) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Restitution Worksheet received and filed./ds
Sentencing Memorandum for Doneal Bell received and filed./ds

Attorney Daniel M. Adams by phone, defendant Doneal Bell not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Order for presentence investigation received and filed.

Attorney Daniel M. Adams in court, defendant Doneal Bell not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo for Sara Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Codefendant's case is set for jury trial on 1-20-15.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel M. Adams in court, defendant Doneal Bell not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Codefendant is not sure how he will be proceeding with his case.  Court adjourns case for further status.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders a presentence investigation, but STAYS the order until after the codefendant's jury trial.  Court will lift the stay after the jury trial date is set.  Order received and filed.  Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.

Defendant Doneal Bell in court with attorney Daniel M. Adams.  Defendant Doneal Bell in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the amended information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Count 1) Attempt Robbery, Armed (Use of Force) PTAC 943.32(1)(a) & (2), 939.32, 939.05 a Class C Felony.  Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Parties as case be set earlier for a change of plea.  Case set for 10-14-14 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44./ds

Attorney Daniel M. Adams in court, defendant Doneal Bell not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has reviewed discovery.  Defense moves for an adjournment for further negotiations.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel M. Adams in court, defendant Doneal Bell not in court, in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Adams has received discovery.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Doneal Bell in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Doneal Bell in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is not ready to enter a plea today.   Defendant wishes to have new counsel.  Court advises the defendant he is allowed two appointments by the Public Defender's Office.  If motion is granted, this will be his second and final appointment.  Defendant states he understands.  Court grants motion and allows Attorney McCandless to withdraw as counsel of record subject to public defender's office appointing new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Doneal Bell in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Doneal Bell in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense is asking for an adjournment.  Defendant was given misinformation and would like time to discuss the case with his attorney.  Case cannot be tried with codefendant due to Bruton issues.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Doneal Bell not in court, defendant in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case called at 8:50 a.m.  No appearance by defense attorney.  Court will be starting a lengthy motion and releases the district attorney to go to other Courts.

Defendant Doneal Bell in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Doneal Bell in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
  Bail motion by defense argued.  Court modified the bail.  Cash bail set with TURN OVER TO JusticePoint for 24 HOUR GPS monitoring.  Court ordered absolutely no release from home.  Court ordered the defendant have not contact with co-defendant Antonio Scarbrough (2014CF001279), the victim or victim's family. Case remains scheduled for plea hearing on 87/7/2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Br 44.    Case is adjourned to   Br 44.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Doneal Bell not in court, in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense has received discovery and believes this matter will resolve.  Parties request a plea date closer to the co-defendant's jury trial date.  Parties advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter is be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44 in room 506 of the Safety Building.  Case scheduled for projected guilty plea on 8/7/2014 at 8:30 a.m.  Defense also request a bail/bond hearing. Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 05-23-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Doneal Bell in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Doneal Bell in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  State informs the Court that this defendant would not be available to testify if called as a witness in the Preliminary Hearing of co-defendant, Antonio Scarbrough.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Doneal Bell in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Doneal Bell in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
